title: Nintendo speaks up about Pokemon Scarlet and Violet - Kinda Funny Games Daily 12.01.22
description:
Wishlist Portal with RTX at https://store.steampowered.com/app/2012840/Portal_with_RTX/

Go to http://chime.com/kfgames to start your credit journey with Chime.

Go to http://shadyrays.com to shop their Black Friday selections.

Go to http://mintmobile.com/kindafunny to buy any 3-month Mint Mobile plan and get 3 more months free.

Blessing and Tim go VIRTUAL to talk about what Nintendo has to say about Pokemon Scarlet & Violet, Summer Game Fest getting announced, and Game Awards updates.

Time Stamps:
00:00:00 - Start
00:05:21 - Housekeeping
A new Kinda Funny Xcast is up and it’s a review of the Xbox Series X 2 years later. You can catch that right here on Youtube.com/KindaFunnyGames.
Dead Space creator and Striking Distance Studios lead Glen Schofield is coming to stream the Callisto Protocol with us on Twitch and YouTube this Friday at 11 am PT! Come for Mike and Greg trying to survive the nightmare, stay for their gruesome in-game deaths!
PORTAL PARTY: Ask people to wishlist the game on Steam and link to Steam page on VOD description (if you typically do this?) & in any social posts: https://store.steampowered.com/app/2012840/Portal_with_RTX/
Ask your community to tune in to the Portal Party: Dec 6 10am PST on your channel
The Roper Report   -
00:08:00 - Nintendo speaks up about Pokemon Scarlet and Violet - Ryan Dinsdale @ IGN
00:16:26 - Is this more a glaring omission from Nintendo regarding theirs and Pokemon Company’s push for these games? - Best Friends Q:Nano
00:21:56 - Summer Game Fest returns - Press Release
00:29:43 - Valve will give away a free Steam Deck every minute during The Game Awards - Sean Hollister @ The Verge
00:31:45 - Tekken 8 will reportedly be shown during The Game Awards - Chris Scullion @ VGC
00:39:26 - We’ve got new Last of Us HBO posters - Logan Plant @ IGN
00:47:00 - Twitch is implementing its own ‘panic button’ safety feature - Ash Parrish @ The Verge
00:50:46 - A former Zelda director is working on an Open World Dress Up RPG - Ryan Dinsdale @ IGN
00:59:30 - Out today
01:05:00 - You‘re Wrong
